faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Answers to common questions about the admission process

pdf_upload.question: Does the system support multiple PDF uploads?
pdf_upload.answer: Yes, the system allows uploading academic records in PDF format and other certificates or awards. Each file should not exceed 5MB.

eligibility.question: How do I know if my child's application is eligible?
eligibility.answer: After submitting the online application, the system will automatically extract information and display results in the "Application Status" section. If eligible, parents will receive an email invitation to submit documents in person.

inaccurate_info.question: What if the extracted information from academic records is inaccurate?
inaccurate_info.answer: If the system extracts information inaccurately, the application will be placed in pending status. An administrator will review and update the information.

documents.question: What documents should I bring when submitting in person?
documents.answer: Parents need to bring original copies of academic records, birth certificate, and certificates or awards (if any) that were uploaded to the system for verification.

exam_info.question: How do I find out my child's exam schedule and room?
exam_info.answer: After the application is confirmed during in-person submission, the system will automatically send an email to parents with complete information about the candidate number, exam room, and schedule.
